articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Intense rains in the wake of Typhoon Khanun lashed the mountainous parts of Taiwan on Saturday, unleashing flood and landslides that blocked roads and stranded hundreds of people as authorities rushed to resume transportation links.
articles.title: Heavy rains wreak havoc in central Taiwan in wake of typhoon

articles.author: Ruma Paul
articles.description: Bangladesh is grappling with a record deadly outbreak of dengue fever, with hospitals struggling to make space for patients as the disease spreads rapidly in the densely-populated country.
articles.title: Bangladesh grapples with record deadly outbreak of dengue fever

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three people were killed and houses set ablaze in fresh violence in India's Manipur, police officials said late on Friday, as sporadic violence and killings continue in the remote northeastern state.
articles.title: Three people killed, houses set ablaze in fresh violence in India's Manipur state

articles.author: Catarina Demony, Michael Gore
articles.description: Thousands of Catholics congregated from before dawn on Saturday at Portugal's Fatima shrine where Pope Francis will pray the rosary with sick youngsters, people with disabilities and inmates.
articles.title: Faithful descend on Portugal's Fatima shrine to see Pope Francis

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An American publishing executive died after being knocked overboard in a boating accident off the Amalfi Coast in southern Italy, the Association of American Publishers (AAP) said.
articles.title: U.S. publishing executive killed in Italian boating accident

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim
articles.description: South Korea decided on Saturday to press on with hosting the World Scout Jamboree, despite warnings about the dangers posed by the extreme heat the country is enduring, and the U.S. and British contingents pulling out a week early.
articles.title: Despite heatwave warnings, South Korea presses on with world scout jamboree

articles.author: Luis Jaime Acosta
articles.description: A judge late on Friday granted Nicolas Petro, the eldest son of Colombian President Gustavo Petro, conditional freedom while he faces money laundering and illicit enrichment charges connected to financing for his father's campaign.
articles.title: Judge grants conditional freedom for son of Colombian president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A sea drone attack damaged a Russian tanker near the strategic bridge linking Russia to the annexed peninsula of Crimea, Russian authorities said on Saturday.
articles.title: Russian tanker hit by sea drone near Crimea Bridge

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors flagged a threatening social media post from Donald Trump in a late-night court filing on Friday, arguing that it suggests he might intimidate witnesses by improperly disclosing confidential evidence received from the government.
articles.title: Trump's threatening post flagged by U.S. prosecutors to judge

articles.author: Ben Winck
articles.description: American workers have given up on quitting. Amid last month’s financial results from Wall Street was a warning from some firms that staff haven’t exited at the rate employers expected. The U.S. economy has weathered inflation without widespread layoffs so far, but a Great Unresignation could make seemingly healthy job numbers harder to read.
articles.title: Next job-market challenge: the Great Unresignation
